meanings.definition: To curve downward or away from a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The road started to decurve as we descended the hill.
meanings.sent2: The river gently decurved around the bend.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to decurve its tail in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to decurve the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstroke beautifully decurved across the canvas.

meanings.definition: The act of curving downward or away from a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The decurve of the path made it challenging to see what was ahead.
meanings.sent2: The decurve of the bridge added elegance to its design.
meanings.sent3: The decurve of the banana peel caused a comical slip.
meanings.sent4: The decurve of the mountain range resembled a sleeping dragon.
meanings.sent5: The decurve of the rainbow painted a colorful arc in the sky.
